channel.title: Nix on knowledge base
channel.description: Recent content in Nix on knowledge base

item.title: Understanding the /bin, /sbin, /usr/sbin Split
item.description:
The /bin directory contains commands which may be used by both the system administrator and by users, but which are required when no other filesystems are mounted (e.g. in single user mode). It may also contain commands which are used indirectly by scripts.

The /sbin directory contains commands which are usually only needed by the system administrator, for system maintenance. System administration programs that are required for system repair, system recovery, mounting /usr, or other essential functions must be placed in /sbin instead of /bin. It may also contain commands which are indirectly used by scripts.
